WorkItem.Description:
When reading certain formulae that rely on default argument values from worksheets saved using Excel 2007, and the same formula saved using Excel 95
Formula =ACCRINTM("1/1/2003","1/7/2003",0.04,,1)
Expected Value in is Excel 2007 is: 1.9835616438356166E-5
Expected Value in Excel 95 is: 19.83561643835617
Calculated Value is: 19.83561643835617
The ACCRINTM default value for the par argument (passed as a null in the above example) is 1000 in Excel 95, but 0.001 in Excel 5.
Â 
There may well be other functions where default argument values have been changed as well
WorkItem.Summary: Function Argument default values differ between Excel5 and Excel2007

Comments.Message:
Interesting.

I believe that PHPExcel is expected to use same default value as in Microsoft Office Excel 2007. No?
Where do you see that, Mark "The ACCRINTM default value for the par argument (passed as a null in the above example) is 1000 in Excel 95, but 0.001 in Excel 5." ?
